member.summary: get max connection count per task

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessagePType
member.summary: presentation type,is intended as an enumerate type defining the presentation layer message type - how the message header and message text are encoded 1-127 reserved for subsidiary standards 128-255 reserved,not used

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsConnectionState.NOT_CONNECTED
member.summary: the entity is ready to listen for or initiate tcp/ip coneections but either has not yet established and connection or all previously established tcp/ip connections have been terminated

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsConnectionState.NOT_SELECTED
member.summary: a substate of connected in which no HSMS session has been established or any previously established HSMS session has ended

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsConnectionState.SELECTED
member.summary: a substate of connected in which at least on HSMS session has been established

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageSType
member.summary: session type,is an enumerated type identifying whether this message is an HSMS data message or HSMS control message 0=data message other=control message

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageSType.Deselect_req
member.summary: Deselect is not to be used for HSMS-SS(use Seperate instead) for HSMS-GS only 00000011

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsSelectStatusCode
member.summary: select status code(select.rsp header byte3),A code of zero indicates success of the select operation,A non-zero code indicates failure

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsSelectStatusCode.Communication_Already_Active
member.summary: (HSMS)a previous select has already established communications to the entity being selected in this select

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsSelectStatusCode.Connection_Not_Ready
member.summary: (HSMS)the connection is not yet ready to accept select requests

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsSelectStatusCode.Connection_Exhaust
member.summary: (HSMS)the connection was accepted but the entity is already servicing a separate TCP/IP connection and is unable to service more than one at any given time

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsSelectStatusCode.No_Such_Entity
member.summary: (HSMS-GS)session id does not correspond to any session entity i available at this connection

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsSelectStatusCode.Entity_In_Use_By_Another_Connection
member.summary: (HSMS-GS)session entity corresponding to session id is not sharable connections and is already selected by another connection

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsSelectStatusCode.Entity_Selected_By_Current_Connection
member.summary: (HSMS-GS)session entity corresponding to Session id is already selected on current connection

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsDeselectStatusCode
member.summary: deselect status code(deselect.rsp header byte3) A code of zero indicates success of the deselect operation,A non-zero code indicates failure

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsDeselectStatusCode.Communication_Not_Established
member.summary: hsms commnuication has not yet been estalished with a select or has already been ended with a previous deselect

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsDeselectStatusCode.Communication_Busy
member.summary: the session is still in use by the responing entity and so it cannot yet relinquish it gracefully,if the original requester must terminate communications the separate procedure should be used as a last resort

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsTask
member.summary: Hsms Task,represent a logic thread to handle message in/out/timeout in connections

member.summary: connection list belongs to this task

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsRejectReasonCode
member.summary: reject reason code(reject.req header byte3),always non-zero

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsRejectReasonCode.SType_Not_Supported
member.summary: a message was received whose SType value not defined in the HSMS standard or the particular subsidiary standard supported by the entity

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsRejectReasonCode.Transaction_Not_Open
member.summary: a response control message was received when there was no outstanding request message which corresponded to it

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsRejectReasonCode.Entity_Not_Selected
member.summary: a data message was received when not in the SELECTED status

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsConnectMode
member.summary: HSMS connect mode HSMS restricts an entity to one of the following modes - passive mode or active mode

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsConnectMode.Passive
member.summary: passive mode is used when the local entity listens for and accepts a connection procedure initiated by the remote entity

member.name: F:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsConnectMode.Active
member.summary: active mode is used when the connect procedure is initiated by the local entity

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader
member.summary: 0-1 Session ID (Device ID) 2 Header Byte 2 (for PType=0 => wbit(bit 7),stream(bit 6-0)) 3 Header Byte 3 (for PType=0 => function(bit 7-0),the LSB(bit 0)of function define data message primary(1)/reply(0)) 4 PType(presentation type,0=SECSII message encoding) 5 SType(session type,0=data message,other=control message) 6-9 System Bytes

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.DeviceId
member.summary: get/set (HSMS-SS) device id,a 15-bit field in the message header used to identify a subentity within the equipment 0-32767

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.SessionId
member.summary: get/set session id which is A 16-bit unsigned integer value field in the message header used to provide an association by reference between control message(perticlularly select and deselect) and subsequent data messages byte 0 is MSB(byte),byte 1 is LSB(byte) In HSMS-SS control message's session id whill always assume the special value 0xFFFF(all bits set)

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.HeaderByte2
member.summary: header byte 2 for control message,it contains 0 or statue code(reject ptype/stype) for data message and ptype=0,it contains wbit and secs stream for data message and ptype !=0,custom define

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.Stream
member.summary: get/set SECS Stream,7 bit usigned int value

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.HeaderByte3
member.summary: header byte 3 for control message,it conatins 0 or status code(select status/deselect status/reject reasoncode) for data message and ptype=0,it contains the secs function for data message and ptype !=0,custom define

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.Function
member.summary: get/set SECS Function,8 bit usigned int value

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.PrimaryOrReply
member.summary: get/set data message is primary(1) or Reply(0)

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.PType
member.summary: get/set presention type which is an enumerated type defining how the message header and message text are encoded

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.SType
member.summary: get/set session type which is an enumerated type identifying whether this message is HSMS Data Message or other HSMS Control Messages

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessageHeader.SystemBytes
member.summary: get/set systembytes which is used to identify a transaction uniquely among the set of open transactions

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessage
member.summary: HSMS Message struct format=> message length (4 bytes) message header (10 bytes) message text (0-n bytes) Message Length is transmitted MSB(byte) first and LSB(byte) last the minimum possible message length is 10 (header only)

member.name: M:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessage.ByteArrayToHexString(System.Byte[],System.String@)
member.summary: byte array convert to hex string

member.name: M:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessage.HexStringToByteArray(System.String,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32@,System.String@)
member.summary: hex string convert to byte array

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessage.TextBytes
member.summary: get/set message text bytes array,null if control message

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessage.IsNotOpenTransaction
member.summary: flag to indicate that secondary reply message doesn't match any primary out message (maybe T3 timeout)

member.name: P:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.HsmsMessage.Tag
member.summary: get/set user object attached to message, reply's tag will copy from primary's tag

member.name: T:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.RockeyAPI
member.summary: rokey4nd api to access and operate keypro hardware

members.member: Return Type: WORD->unsigned short function: WORD->unsigned short handle: WORD* lp1: DWORD* lp2: DWORD* p1: WORD* p2: WORD* p3: WORD* p4: WORD* buffer: BYTE*

member.name: M:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.RockeyAPI.Find(System.UInt16@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary:
to check if a sepcific rockey4nd is attached to the usb port
p1=Password 1
p2=Password 2
p3=Password 3(optional)
p4=Password 4(optional)
return lp1=Hardware ID(HID)

member.name: M:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.RockeyAPI.FindNext(System.UInt16@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary:
to check if another sepcific rockey4nd is attached to the usb port
p1=Password 1
p2=Password 2
p3=Password 3(optional)
p4=Password 4(optional)
return lp1=Hardware ID(HID)

member.summary:
to open a rocket4nd dongle with specified passwords or hardware id
p1=Password 1
p2=Password 2
p3=Password 3(optional)
p4=Password 4(optional)
lp1=Hardware ID(HID)
return handle=Rockey4ND's Handle

to close a rocket4nd dongle with specified handle

member.summary:
to read the contents of the Uer Data Zone(UDZ)

p2=length(unit is byte)
buffer=address of buffer

lp2=Seed Code
return p1=code1,p2=code2,p3=code3,p4=code4

member.name: M:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.RockeyAPI.SetModule(System.UInt16@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary:
to write a vlaue to a specific Rockey4ND module and set the decrement attribute
handle=Rockey4ND's Handle
p1=Module Number(0-63)
p2=Module Unit Value
p3=if decreasing is allowed(1=allowed,0=not allowed)

member.name: M:Unicom.UniAuto.Net.HSMS.RockeyAPI.CheckModule(System.UInt16@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary:
to read the attirbutes of a specific Rockey4ND module
handle=Rockey4ND's Handle
p1=Module Number(0-63)
return p2=zero value attribute(1=module value is not zero)
p3=decrement attribute(1=module can be decreased)

member.summary:
to decrease the value in a specified ROCKEY4ND module by 1
handle=Rockey4ND's Handle
p1=module number

member.summary:
to write user-defined mathematical instructions to the User Algorithm Zone(UAZ)

p1=position of first instruction in UAZ buffer
buffer=the algorithm command string

to return the results of a calculation performed in ROCKEY4ND calculate1 function

lp1=start point of calculation

p3=input value 3
